Title.evidence: Randomised Controlled Trial of PLX-PAD in Chronic Limb-Threatening Ischaemia

Participants.evidence: patients with chronic limb-threatening ischaemia (CLTI) who are not candidates for revascularization

Intervention.evidence: randomised 2:1 to receive PLX-PAD or placebo

Objective.evidence: assessed whether PLX-PAD could improve amputation-free survival (AFS)

Method_Outcome.evidence: The primary outcome was AFS, defined as the time from randomisation to major amputation or death, assessed over 12-36 months.

Randomisation_Allocation.evidence: Randomisation used permuted blocks, and allocation was concealed via an interactive web-based system.

Blinding.evidence: Blinding included patients, clinicians, and outcome assessors.

Number_Randomised.evidence: From September 2017 to November 2020, 143 patients were randomised to PLX-PAD and 70 to placebo

Number_Analysed.evidence: 205 patients analysed using an intention-to-treat approach

Harms.evidence: Adverse events occurred in 73.5% of PLX-PAD and 82.6% of placebo patients
